article:
{{Infobox royalty |name = Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani |image = Hamad bin
Khalifa Al Thani (cropped).jpg |succession = Emir of Qatar |reign = 27 June 1995
â 25 June 2013 |predecessor = Khalifa bin Hamad Al Thani |suc-type = Successor
|successor = Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani |reg-type = |regent = |succession1 = Prime
Minister of Qatar |reign1 = 27 June 1995 â 29 October 1996 |predecessor1 =
Khalifa bin Hamad Al Thani |successor1 = Abdullah bin Khalifa Al Thani |spouse =
Mariam bint Muhammad Mozah bint Nasser Noora bint Khalid |issue = [[Hamad
bin Khalifa Al Thani#Marriages and children|See link]] |house = House of Thani
|father = Khalifa bin Hamad Al Thani |mother = Sheikha Al-Atiyyah |birth_date =
1952 |birth_place = Doha, Qatar |death_date = |death_place = |religion = Sunni
Islam }} (New York). From left to right: Sheikha Mozah, second wife of the
emir, Michelle Obama, First Lady of the United States, the Emir, and Barack
Obama, U.S. President.]] '[[Sheikh]] Hamad bin Khalifa Al Thani' (, born 1952)
was the ruling Emir of the State of Qatar from 1995 to
2013.

Sheikh Hamad is credited with transforming Qatar from an underdeveloped, Bedouin
nation into a bustling modern country. 15 January 2012 CBS 60
Minutes - Qatar: A tiny country asserts powerful influence

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b_ZuXbOtBbo Under his reign, the country
won the right to stage the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Doha, the first event of its
kind to occur in the Middle East. 2 December 2010 The Guardian - Qatar win
2022 World Cup bid

http://www.guardian.co.uk/football/2010/dec/02/qatar-win-2022-world-cup-
bid Under the patronage of Sheikh Hamad and his wife Sheikha Mozah bint
Nasser Al-Misnad, several world-class academic institutions have opened campuses
in Doha, including Carnegie Mellon University, Georgetown University,
Northwestern University, Texas A&M University and Weill Cornell Medical
College.

In the arts, Sheikh Hamad established the Qatar Museums Authority in 2005 which
built the I. M. Pei designed Museum of Islamic Art Doha. Since opening, Qatar
has become the world's biggest contemporary art buyer, 7 July 2011
Forbes - Qatar revealed as the world's biggest contemporary art buyer

http://www.forbes.com/sites/abigailesman/2011/07/07/qatar-revealed-as-the-
worlds-biggest-contemporary-art-buyer-the-art-newspaper/ famously
purchasing CÃ©zanne's [[The Card Players]]in 2012 for over $250 million
USD. February 2012 Vanity Fair - Qatar Purchases CÃ©zanneâs The Card
Playersfor More Than $250 Million, Highest Price Ever for a Work of Art

http://www.vanityfair.com/culture/2012/02/qatar-buys-cezanne-card-players-
201202 The Museum Authority sponsored Takashi Murakami's EGO exhibit in
Doha which ran from 9 February to 24 June 2012, 9 February 2012 Huffington
Post - Takashi Murakami's "Ego" Exhibition At Al Riwaq Exhibition Hall In
Doha, Qatar

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/08/takashi-murakamis-
ego_n_1263888.html Damien Hirst's retrospective at Tate Modern in Spring
and Summer 2012 5 April 2012 The National - Qatari royal family sponsors
Damien Hirst retrospective at Tate Modern

http://www.thenational.ae/arts-culture/art/qatari-royal-family-sponsors-damien-
hirst-retrospective-at-tate-modern and his upcoming exhibition Relic,
slated to open in Doha in October 2013. 7 July 2013 Saffron Art - Relic by
Damien Hirst lands in Doha

http://blog.saffronart.com/2013/07/07/relic-by-damien-hirst-lands-in-doha/
In July 2013, in conjunction with Miuccia Prada and the Prada Foundation, QMA
launched CURATE, a global search for curatorial talent. 12 July 2013
Gallerist NY - Qatar and Prada Announce âCurateâ Prize

http://galleristny.com/2013/07/qatar-and-prada-announce-curate-prize/
Additionally, the Doha Film Institute was established in 2009 which in
partnership with the Tribeca Film Festival (founded by Robert DeNiro), created
the Doha Tribeca Film Festival that ran from 2009 - 2012. 30 April 2013 The
Hollywood Reporte r - Tribeca Enterprises, Qatar's Doha Film Institute
End Cultural, Festival Partnership

http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/tribeca-enterprises-qatars-doha-film-
448915 The Doha Film Institute is producing Salma Hayek's upcoming
animated adaptation of Khalil Gibran's classic novel The Prophet, with
"Lion King" director Roger Allers co-ordinating the process. 23 February
2012 The Hollywood Reporter - Salma Hayek and Doha Film Institute to Adapt
Khalil Gibranâs 'The Prophet' into Animated Movie

http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/salma-hayek-doha-film-institute-Khalil-
Gibran-prophet-294555 DFI is also credited as a production company on
several other films, including Just Like a Woman starring Sienna Miller, 17
July 2013 IMDB - Just Like a Woman

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1855236/ The Reluctant Fundamentalist directed
by Mira Nair which opened 69th Venice International Film Festival, 30 August
2013 BBC News - The Reluctant Fundamentalist

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-19421160 and Kanye West's
Cruel Summer - a short film which shot in Doha and premiered during the 2012
Cannes Film Festival. 23 May 2012 The Hollywood Reporter - Cannes 2012:
Kanye West Debuts Groundbreaking Film With Kim Kardashian, Jay-Z in Attendance

http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/kanye-west-kim-kardashian-cannes-jay-z-
premiere-328795 In February 2013, they announced a $100 million feature
film fund with Participant Media, a production company founded by billionaire
Jeffrey Skoll, who was the first employee and also first president of internet
auction firm eBay. 13 February 2013 Deadline - Berlin: Participant Media,
Doha Film Institute Launch Five-Year $100M Feature Film Fund www.deadline.com/2013/02/participant-media-doha-film-institute-launch-five-
year-100m-feature-film-fund/

In 2005, under the direction of Sheikh Hamad and the former Prime Minister of
Qatar Sheikh Hamad bin Jassim bin Jaber Al Thani, the Qatar Investment Authority
was established, a sovereign wealth fund to manage the country's oil and natural
gas surpluses. 17 July 2013 - Qatar Investment Authority
http://www.qia.qa The Qatar Investment Authority and its subsidiaries have
acquired many businesses abroad, including London's iconic department store
Harrods from entrepreneur Mohammed Al-Fayed, 8 May 2010 Reuters -
Qatar investor buys UK department store Harrods

http://www.reuters.com/article/2010/05/08/us-harrods-idUSTRE6470V520100508
Paris based department store Printemps, 8 April 2013 The Wall Street Journal
- Qatari Investors to Buy Printemps

http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424127887324050304578410763931853602.html French football club Paris Saint-Germain F.C., 24 May 2013 NY Times -
Qatari Hopes for Paris Saint-Germain Meet Reality

http://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/25/world/europe/25iht-letter25.html a
former 10% stake in Porsche, 17 June 2013 Reuters - Qatar sells back 10
percent Porsche stake to founding families

http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/06/17/us-qatar-porsche-volkswagen-
idUSBRE95G08E20130617 a 75% stake in film studio Miramax which they
acquired from Disney, 21 January 2013 The Hollywood Reporter - Ron Tutor
Sells His Miramax Stake

http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/ron-tutor-sells-his-miramax-414171 a
2% stake in media conglomerate and Universal Music Group parent company
Vivendi, 21 March 2012 Bloomberg - Vivendi Says Shareholder Qatar Holding
Raised its Stake to 2%tp://www.bloomberg.com/news/2012-03-21/vivendi-says-shareholder-qatar-
holding-raised-its-stake-to-2-.html a $100 million USD investment in
Chernin Group - whose founder Peter Chernin was COO of News Corp and President
of Fox, 8 November 2012 LA Times - Chernin Group receives $100-million
investment from Qatar Holding

http://articles.latimes.com/2012/nov/08/entertainment/la-et-ct-chernin-
investment-qatar-holdings-20121108 a 1% stake in luxury goods manufacturer
Louis Vuitton MoÃ«t Hennessy, 16 March 2012 Vogue - Slice Of LVMH

http://www.vogue.co.uk/news/2012/03/16/qatar-holdings-buys-lvmh-stake a 6%
stake in Credit Suisse, 14 February 2011 Bloomberg - Credit Suisse Raises
$6.2 Billion From Qatar Holding, Olayan

http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-14/credit-suisse-places-sf6-billion-in-
tier-1-buffer-capital-notes.html a 12.6% stake in Barclays 5
February 2013 Reuters - Barclays ducks Qatar questions, takes $1.6 billion mis-
selling hit

http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/02/05/us-barclays-
idUSBRE91408O20130205 and several other major companies. They also backed
Glencore's$31 billion USD takeover bid for Xstrata. 15 November 2012 NY
Times - Qatar Wealth Fund Backs Glencoreâs Bid for Xstrata

http://dealbook.nytimes.com/2012/11/15/qatar-holding-supports-glencore-xstrata-
deal/ Qatar is the largest property owner in London with their holdings
including Europe's tallest building The Shard, Olympic Village and Park Lane's
InterContinental Hotel. 21 June 2013 The Independent - Sheikh Hamad bin
Jassim bin Jaber al-Thani: Meet the man who bought London

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/sheikh-hamad-bin-jassim-bin-
jaber-althani-meet-the-man-who-bought-london-8669134.html They also own
several hotels in Cannes including the Majestic Hotel, Grand Hyatt Cannes HÃ´tel
Martinez and Carlton Hotel. 15 December 2011 Pie Mag - Cannes Carlton hotel
sold to Qatar investor for â¬450m

http://www.pie-mag.com/articles/2360/cannes-carlton-hotel-sold-to-qatar-
investor-for-euro-450m/ QIA was considered to have one of the leading bids
in the sales of both Anschutz Entertainment Group 13 November 2012 NY
Pos t - AEG shoots for stars with up to $10B sale

http://www.nypost.com/p/news/business/aeg_shoots_for_stars_with_up_to_lN4j5RKTq-
7mu7X8S2vRqPM and Hulu. 9 June 2013 Arabian Business - Qatar among
bidders for US online TV fir

http://www.arabianbusiness.com/qatar-among-bidders-for-us-online-tv-firm-
504486.html As of May 2013, it was reported the Investment Authority is in
talks to purchase Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman. 31 May 2013 NY Post -
Qatar Investment Authority in talks to buy Neiman Marcus

http://www.nypost.com/p/news/business/neiman_plays_qatar_Sh8F0MnsFr9LmwdXyl-
supM

Sheikh Hamad is famous for helping to establish the first Arab international
news network, Al Jazeera, when he provided a loan of QAR 500 million ($137
million) to sustain Al Jazeera through its first five years. Sheikh Hamad's
support of Al Jazeera has played an integral role in sparking the Arab Spring
and creating uprisings in Tunisia, Egypt, Libya, Yemen and Syria.

In October 2012, Sheikh Hamad made a historic visit to Gaza and pledged $400
million USD in humanitarian aid to Hamas, to build infrastructure projects and
hospitals. 23 October 2012 NY Times - Qatarâs Emir Visits Gaza, Pledging
$400 Million to Hamas

http://www.nytimes.com/2012/10/24/world/middleeast/pledging-400-million-
qatari-emir-makes-historic-visit-to-gaza-strip.html?_r=0 Despite Qatar's
ties to Hamas, they maintain diplomatic and business relations with
Israel. 2 May 2013 Wall Street Journal - Qatari Sheikh Said to Want to
Visit Israel on Business

http://blogs.wsj.com/middleeast/2013/05/02/qatari-sheikh-said-to-want-to-visit-
israel-on-business/ Sheikh Hamad provided financial and material support
to opposition rebels in both the Libyan civil war, which led to the overthrow of
Muammar Gaddafi, and the ongoing Syrian Revolution which seeks to oust President
Bashar al-Assad. [3] It has been reported that he has also
provided support to organizations such as Ansar Dine Is
Qatar fuelling the crisis in north Mali? , France 24, Latest update: 23 January
2013 , http://www.france24.com/en/20130121-qatar-mali-france-ansar-dine-mnla-al-qaeda-
sunni-islam-doha and the Movement for Unity and Jihad in West Africa, who are fighting for independence in the Northern Mali
conflict, as well as the Al-Nusra Front. Editorial, Al
Qaeda in Syria, 10 December 2012, http://www.nytimes.com/2012/12/11/opinion/al-qaeda-in-
syria.html?_r=0

On June 25, 2013, Sheikh Hamad announced he would be handing over power to his
33-year old son Sheikh Tamim. The move was seen as groundbreaking for the Middle
East, where leaders typically stay in office until their death. 25 June 2013
NY Times - In Surprise, Emir of Qatar Plans to Abdicate, Handing Power to Son

http://www.nytimes.com/2013/06/25/world/middleeast/qatar-transfer-of-
power.html?pagewanted=all
